data.title: The George and Ira Gershwin Critical Edition
data.text:
While George Gershwin created some of the most famous melodies in music history, his brother Ira Gershwin is celebrated for his brilliant lyrics. The George and Ira Gershwin Critical Edition will be the first-ever scholarly edition of the music and lyrics of George and Ira Gershwin.

Conductors, musicians, performers, scholars and the audiences alike will gain greater insight into the Gershwins’ original material. In many cases, the critical edition will offer the first performance materials to accurately reflect the creators’ vision.

Each volume will include an introductory essay focusing on the genesis of the compositions, as well as a critical commentary explaining all editorial decisions regarding the presentation of the works.

The project was made possible by the partnership of the School of Music, Theatre & Dance at the University of Michigan (Ann Arbor) with the Heirs of George Gershwin and the Ira and Leonore Gershwin Trusts. In addition, the project was supported by individual donors and a grant from the United States National Endowment for the Humanities.

The critical edition will comprise more than 60 volumes (divided into 10 series) and will be published by Schott Music. Add the email address info@news.harrassowitz.de to your address book or your list of safe senders. This ensures that you will continue to receive our e-mails in the future.

This newsletter was sent to max.mustermann@news.harrassowitz.de. This newsletter is only sent to you with your approval. If you don’t want to receive this newsletter anymore, please click here.
